intro: Pseudostenomesson morrisonii, commonly known as Morrison's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
